#Text=Benguela
#Text=Benguela is a city in Central Angola .
#Text=Understand
#Text=Founded by Portuguese general Manuel Cerveira Pereira in 1617 .
#Text=Benguela was long the centre of the slave trade to Brazil and Cuba .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Benguela Airport ( BUG Aeroporto de Benguela - 17 de Setembro ) .
#Text=Benguela 's airport is borderline defunct , with all commercial passenger flights routed through nearby Catumbela airport
#Text=Catumbela Airport ( CBT ) ( to the north right between Benguela and Lobito .
#Text=) .
#Text=with regular service from Luanda and Lubango .
#Text=By car
#Text=By road , it is about an seven-hour drive from Luanda , once you clear Luanda 's traffic .
#Text=By train
#Text=Travelling by rail is once again an option , but trains are infrequent and slow .
#Text=There is a daily commuter train from nearby Lobito and at least a once-weekly overnight train from Huambo , with connections from Luao next to the border with the Democratic Republic of Congo .
#Text=is located on Rue 31 de Janeiro .
#Text=See
#Text=There are some pretty colonial buildings in Benguela .
#Text=A few are pictured in this article .
#Text=Beaches
#Text=There are several beautiful beaches around Benguela , including one right in the city center !
#Text=The best beach resort hotel , though , is in Lobito .
#Text=The beaches outside the city are close by and easy to reach by car , either your own or a hired taxi .
#Text=They 're really beautiful too , with the bluest water , the whitest sand , and most are flanked by dramatic cliffs .
#Text=But remember that tourist facilities are limited and beaches are not well-maintained .
#Text=A visit with high expectations of a tropical paradise vacation risks disappointment .
#Text=Baia Azul ( Baia Farta ) .
#Text=This is the most famous beach in Angola .
#Text=If postcards were a thing in this country , this would crop up frequently .
#Text=It is named for its exceptionally blue waters .
#Text=There are only a few restaurants , and few people as well — it 's a nice , quiet retreat .
#Text=There is at least one hotel here ( see Hotel Duas Faces below ) .
#Text=Caotinha Beach .
#Text=This is a series of little beach inlets just south of Benguela , some of which are totally deserted .
#Text=You can hike from one to the next .
#Text=Praia Morena .
#Text=This is the city 's main beach , right near the center .
#Text=On holidays it can get extremely crowded , but it 's usually empty .
#Text=It 's a fairly narrow stretch of sand between the road and the ocean , but the water is and sand are both nice .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Praia Morena Hotel , R. José Estevan , 25 , ☏ +244916076902 .
#Text=Outside Benguela
#Text=Hotel Duas Faces ( Baia Azul ) , ☏ +244922508508 .
#Text=An attractive boutique hotel at Baia Azul with ocean views , parking , and an on-site restaurant .
#Text=It 's not right on the beach .
#Text=Go next
#Text=Caotinha is on a peninsula west of Benguela .
#Text=Lobito is 33 kilometres north of Benguela .
